DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to allergic reaction(s) to contrast media.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/7/14 released DEC. tt 8/19/13 curated for imaging trials.tt

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Applicable Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, Unknown, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, unknown, or not applicable.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.2.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Retired DBW 04-27-2016 requested By Tina Taylor approved by Dianne Reeves

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership  transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. 3/23/16 jk value "Not evaluable" added in error by COG on 3/21/16 was removed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Known allergic reactions to c
ReferenceDocuments.description: Known allergic reactions to contrast media?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6690
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have a known allergy-like reaction to contrast media (iodinated or extracellular gadolinium that does not have dominant hepatobiliary excretion) OR moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the ACR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: E4112 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any known allergy-like reactions to gadolinium OR moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the ACR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1141 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any known allergy-like reaction to gadolinium or moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the American College of Radiology (ACR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAF151 CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have any known allergy-like reactions to gadolinium OR moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the American College of Radiology (ACR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EAI141 CRF
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does participant have any known allergy-like reactions to gadolinium OR moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the ACR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CE7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a known allergy to gadolinium?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to tolerate MRI brain with gadolinium-based contrast.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have allergies to agents that may potentially be used for non standard of care imaging (18F-fluciclovine, MR contrast)

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have allergies to biomarkers or imaging agents active for the current Arm?
